summary.note: This module is experimental. Documentation is still under development...
summary.p: mod_cache implements an RFC 2616 compliant HTTP content cache that can be used to cache either local or proxied content. mod_cache requires the services of one or more storage management modules. Two storage management modules are included in the base Apache distribution:

dl.dd: implements a disk based storage manager for use with mod_proxy

implements an in-memory based storage manager. mod_mem_cache can be configured to operate in two modes: caching open file descriptors or caching objects in heap storage. mod_mem_cache is most useful when used to cache locally generated content or to cache backend server content for mod_proxy configured for ProxyPass (aka reverse proxy)

summary.p: Content stored and retrived keyed to the URL. Content with access protections is not cached.

section.title: Sample Configuration
section.example:
Sample httpd.conf #
# Sample Cache Configuration
#
LoadModule cache_module modules/mod_cache.so
<IfModule mod_cache.c>
CacheOn On
#LoadModule disk_cache_module modules/mod_disk_cache.so
<IfModule mod_disk_cache.c>
CacheRoot c:/cacheroot
CacheSize 256
CacheEnable disk /
CacheDirLevels 5
CacheDirLength 3
</IfModule>
LoadModule mem_cache_module modules/mod_mem_cache.so
<IfModule mod_mem_cache.c>
MCacheEnable mem /
MCacheSize 4096
MCacheMaxObjectCount 100
MCacheMinObjectSize 1
MCacheMaxObjectSize 2048
</IfModule>
</IfModule>

directivesynopsis.name: CacheEnable
directivesynopsis.description: Enable caching specified URLs in a specified storage manager

usage.p: The CacheEnable directive instructs mod_cache to cache urls at or below url-string. The cache store is specified with the cache_type argument. cache_type mem instructs mod_cache to use the in-memory cache storage manager implemented by mod_mem_cache. cache_type disk instructs mod_cache to use the cache storage manager implemented by mod_disk_cache .
usage.example:
CacheEnable disk /
CacheEnable mem /manual
CacheEnable fd /images

directivesynopsis.name: CacheDisable
directivesynopsis.description: Disable caching of specified URLs by specified storage manager

usage.p: The CacheDisable directive instructs mod_cache to not cache urls at or above url-string.

directivesynopsis.description: The maximum time in seconds to cache a document

usage.p: The maximum time in seconds to cache a document. The CacheMaxExpire takes precedence over the Expire field from the header.
The default time in seconds to cache a document if the page does not have an expiry date in the Expires field.
